Findings: Service accounts svc_tcs_app and svc_tcs_rpt have no expiration configured and passwords have not been rotated in 420+ days. Four inactive user accounts remain enabled.
Eleven standard user accounts have local Administrator group membership on TCS-APP-01 and TCS-DB-01. No documented business justification for elevated access on file.
Screen lock inactivity timeout is set to 30 minutes on TCS-WS-01 and TCS-WS-02. STIG requirement is 15 minutes or less.
Audit policy subcategories for Logon/Logoff and Privilege Use are set to No Auditing on TCS-DB-01. auditpol /get confirms missing event categories.
TCS-WEB-01 is not forwarding IIS access logs to the enterprise SIEM. Splunk Universal Forwarder installed but output configuration missing.
Six POA&M items are past scheduled completion date with no milestone updates. Oldest item is 127 days overdue (POAM-2024-031).
Windows Remote Management (WinRM) is enabled using HTTP (port 5985) on TCS-APP-01. STIG requires HTTPS-only. PowerShell 2.0 Engine remains installed on TCS-DB-01.
Print Spooler service is running and set to Automatic on TCS-APP-01 and TCS-DB-01. No business requirement documented. Telnet Client feature installed on TCS-WEB-01.
Unauthorized software detected: 7-Zip 23.01 and VLC Media Player 3.0.20 found on TCS-WS-02. Neither application is on the approved software list.
Password minimum length GPO is set to 12 characters. STIG requirement is 14 characters. Two service accounts have passwords older than 365 days with no rotation schedule.

Last authenticated vulnerability scan of TCS-DB-01 completed 52 days ago. Policy requires monthly scanning. Tenable scan results show 3 critical CVEs unmitigated: CVE-2024-21413 (CVSS 9.8), CVE-2024-26234 (CVSS 6.7), CVE-2023-36884 (CVSS 8.8).
TLS 1.0 and 1.1 remain enabled in the IIS SSL/TLS configuration on TCS-WEB-01. SCAP scan confirmed deprecated protocol support. Only TLS 1.2 and 1.3 are permitted per STIG.
BitLocker Drive Encryption is not enabled on data volumes (D:\ and E:\) of TCS-DB-01. Database files containing PII are unencrypted at rest.

18 outstanding security patches on TCS-APP-01 and TCS-WEB-01 are more than 30 days old. Four critical patches (CVSS >= 9.0) exceed the 15-day remediation SLA. Windows Update configured to manual on both systems.
Microsoft Defender Antivirus definition files on TCS-WS-01 are 9 days old. Policy requires definitions updated within 3 days. Real-time protection is enabled but signatures are stale.
